techmeme.title: Port, which offers DevOps services, raised a $35M Series B led by Accel and says its revenue is up 7x in the last 12 months while its customer base grew 8x (Mike Wheatley/SiliconANGLE)
Meta rolls out "activity status" to Threads that shows a green dot next to a user's profile picture to show the user is online, if they have the feature enabled (Jay Peters/The Verge)
Court filing: VMware agrees to pay $102.5M to settle a securities fraud class action lawsuit that could apply to those who traded its stock from 2018 to 2020 (Brandon Vigliarolo/The Register)
Decagon, which offers enterprises AI-powered customer service agents, raised a $65M Series B led by Bain Capital Ventures, valuing it at $650M (Rashi Shrivastava/Forbes)
Intel and AMD forge an x86 ecosystem advisory group to ensure a unified x86 instruction set architecture moving forward, amid competition from Arm and RISC-V (Paul Alcorn/Tom's Hardware)
